scenario: Three teams negotiate the allocation of limited GPU resources for their projects, each holding private information about project requirements and regional preferences.
task: Develop a collaborative resource allocation plan that balances GPU distribution based on project needs, team preferences, and regional constraints. Agents must navigate competing interests: while one team may need high-performance GPUs for a short-term project, another may require a longer allocation for a sustained effort. Effective negotiation and selective information sharing are crucial to achieve consensus while safeguarding sensitive project details.

agents.name: Team A Lead
agents.role: Oversees the project requiring GPUs for machine learning model training.
responsibilities: Define GPU requirements based on project scope.
Communicate project timelines and urgency to other teams.
Negotiate GPU allocation with other team leads.
Monitor GPU utilization and performance metrics.

Project Deadline (2 weeks).reason: Sensitive timeline; revealing could affect competitive positioning.

agents.name: Team B Lead
agents.role: Manages a project focused on data analytics requiring GPU resources.
responsibilities: Assess and communicate GPU needs for data processing tasks.
Evaluate the impact of GPU allocation on project timelines.
Collaborate with other teams to optimize resource use.
Report on project progress and GPU performance.

Data Sensitivity (Client data involved).reason: Disclosure risks client trust and data integrity.

agents.name: Team C Lead
agents.role: Leads a long-term research project utilizing GPUs for simulations.
responsibilities: Determine long-term GPU requirements based on research objectives.
Ensure continuous access to GPU resources for simulation tasks.
Collaborate with other teams to align resource needs.
Track GPU performance and report on research findings.

Research Objectives (Long-term simulatio.reason: Sensitive details that could affect funding and partnerships.

GPU Preference (NVIDIA V100).reason: Knowledge of preference could limit bargaining power.

success_criteria.Resource Agreement: All teams agree to a final GPU allocation that meets their minimum requirements without exceeding available resources.
success_criteria.Timeline Alignment: Consensus is reached on project timelines that respect each team's needs for GPU access.
success_criteria.Regional Preferences: Teams agree on regional GPU allocations that consider each team's project requirements and geographical preferences.

deliverable: A strategic resource allocation plan detailing GPU distribution among teams, respecting project needs and preferences.

public: Each team must receive at least 2 GPUs
All projects must be supported within the allocated timeframe
private: No team can exceed their maximum GPU request
Confidential project details must remain undisclosed
Team preferences must be honored to the extent possible

penalties_utilities: Penalties are expressed as utility losses (e.g., -200, -150, -100, -50). Utilities are expressed as gains (e.g., +80, +70, +60, +50).
Consensus_w: Agreement on GPU allocation requires negotiation between all teams to balance their respective needs.
